018package org.opengis.filter.capability;
019
020import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
021
022import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
023
024
025/**
026 * Declaration of which conformance classes a particular implementation supports.
027 *
028 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
029 * @version 3.1
030 *
031 * @see FilterCapabilities#getConformance()
032 *
033 * @since 3.1
034 */
035@UML(identifier="Conformance", specification=ISO_19143)
036public interface Conformance {
037    /**
038     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Query</i> conformance level.
039     *
040     * @return whether implementation supports Query.
041     */
042    @UML(identifier="ImplementsQuery", specification=ISO_19143)
043    default boolean implementsQuery() {
044        return false;
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Ad hoc query</i> conformance level.
049     *
050     * @return whether implementation supports ad hoc query.
051     */
052    @UML(identifier="ImplementsAdHocQuery", specification=ISO_19143)
053    default boolean implementsAdHocQuery() {
054        return false;
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Functions</i> conformance level.
059     *
060     * @return whether implementation supports functions.
061     */
062    @UML(identifier="ImplementsFunctions", specification=ISO_19143)
063    default boolean implementsFunctions() {
064        return false;
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Resource Identification</i> conformance level.
069     *
070     * @return whether implementation supports resource identification.
071     */
072    @UML(identifier="ImplementsResourceld", specification=ISO_19143)
073    default boolean implementsResourceld() {
074        return false;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Minimum Standard Filter</i> conformance level.
079     * A value of {@code true} means that all the logical operators ({@code And}, {@code Or}, {@code Not})
080     * are supported, together with the following comparison operators:
081     *
082     * <blockquote>
083     * {@code PropertyIsEqualTo},
084     * {@code PropertyIsNotEqualTo},
085     * {@code PropertyIsLessThan},
086     * {@code PropertyIsGreaterThan},
087     * {@code PropertyIsLessThanOrEqualTo},
088     * {@code PropertyIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo}
089     * </blockquote>
090     *
091     * Above operators shall be listed in the
092     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getScalarCapabilities() scalar capabilities}.
093     *
094     * @return whether implementation supports minimum standard filter.
095     */
096    @UML(identifier="ImplementsMinStandardFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
097    default boolean implementsMinStandardFilter() {
098        return implementsStandardFilter();
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Standard Filter</i> conformance level.
103     * A value of {@code true} means that all the {@linkplain #implementsMinStandardFilter() minimum
104     * standard filters} are supported, together with the following comparison operators:
105     *
106     * <blockquote>
107     * {@code PropertyIsNull},
108     * {@code PropertyIsNil},
109     * {@code PropertyIsLike},
110     * {@code PropertyIsBetween}
111     * </blockquote>
112     *
113     * Above operators shall be listed in the
114     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getScalarCapabilities() scalar capabilities}.
115     *
116     * @return whether implementation supports standard filter.
117     */
118    @UML(identifier="ImplementsStandardFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
119    default boolean implementsStandardFilter() {
120        return false;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Minimum Spatial Filter</i> conformance level.
125     * A value of {@code true} means that the following spatial operators are supported:
126     *
127     * <blockquote>
128     * {@code BBOX}
129     * </blockquote>
130     *
131     * Above operators shall be listed in the
132     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getSpatialCapabilities() spatial capabilities}.
133     *
134     * @return whether implementation supports minimum spatial filter.
135     */
136    @UML(identifier="ImplementsMinSpatialFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
137    default boolean implementsMinSpatialFilter() {
138        return implementsSpatialFilter();
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Spatial Filter</i> conformance level.
143     * A value of {@code true} means that all the {@linkplain #implementsMinSpatialFilter() minimum
144     * spatial filters} are supported, together with at least one additional spatial operator.
145     * Those operators shall be listed in the
146     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getSpatialCapabilities() spatial capabilities}.
147     *
148     * @return whether implementation supports spatial filter.
149     */
150    @UML(identifier="ImplementsSpatialFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
151    default boolean implementsSpatialFilter() {
152        return false;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Minimum Temporal Filter</i> conformance level.
157     * A value of {@code true} means that the following temporal operators are supported:
158     *
159     * <blockquote>
160     * {@code During}
161     * </blockquote>
162     *
163     * Above operators shall be listed in the
164     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getTemporalCapabilities() temporal capabilities}.
165     *
166     * @return whether implementation supports minimum temporal filter.
167     */
168    @UML(identifier="ImplementsMinTemporalFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
169    default boolean implementsMinTemporalFilter() {
170        return implementsTemporalFilter();
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Temporal Filter</i> conformance level.
175     * A value of {@code true} means that all the {@linkplain #implementsMinTemporalFilter() minimum
176     * temporal filters} are supported, together with at least one additional temporal operator.
177     * Those operators shall be listed in the
178     * {@linkplain FilterCapabilities#getTemporalCapabilities() temporal capabilities}.
179     *
180     * @return whether implementation supports temporal filter.
181     */
182    @UML(identifier="ImplementsTemporalFilter", specification=ISO_19143)
183    default boolean implementsTemporalFilter() {
184        return false;
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Version navigation</i> conformance level.
189     *
190     * @return whether implementation supports version navigation.
191     */
192    @UML(identifier="ImplementsVersionNav", specification=ISO_19143)
193    default boolean implementsVersionNav() {
194        return false;
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Sorting</i> conformance level.
199     *
200     * @return whether implementation supports sorting.
201     */
202    @UML(identifier="ImplementsSorting", specification=ISO_19143)
203    default boolean implementsSorting() {
204        return false;
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Returns whether the implementation supports the <i>Extended Operators</i> conformance level.
209     *
210     * @return whether implementation supports extended operators.
211     */
212    @UML(identifier="ImplementsExtendedOperators", specification=ISO_19143)
213    default boolean implementsExtendedOperators() {
214        return false;
215    }
216}
